Detailed Description

A class that describes a widget hierarchy that can be displayed in another process.

The hierarchy is inflated from a layout resource file, and this class provides some basic operations for modifying the content of the inflated hierarchy.

 // On the your AppWidgetProvider, you can create a RemoteWidget and modify its content.
 const String MyAppWidgetProvider::CLICK_ACTION("MyAppWidgetProvider.CLICK_ACTION");
 gaia::base::String* MyAppWidgetProvider::mspPackageName = new String("MyAppWidgetProviderTest");
 gaia::base::String* MyButtonAppWidgetProvider::mspClassName = new String("MyAppWidgetProviderTest.MyAppWidgetProvider");
 gaia::base::String* MyButtonAppWidgetProvider::mspServiceClassName = new String("MyAppWidgetProviderTest.MyAppWidgetService");

 void MyAppWidgetProvider::onUpdate(Context* context, AppWidgetManager* appWidgetManager, const gaia::base::Array<int32_t> appWidgetIds) {
     RemoteWidget* rw = new RemoteWidget(context->getPackageName(), MyAppWidgetProvider::R::layout::widget_layout);

     // Implement some basic operation on the specific widget.
     Demand* mDemand = new Demand();
     mDemand->setClassName(*mspPackageName, *mspClassName);
     mDemand->setAction(MyAppWidgetProvider::CLICK_ACTION);
     // Set AppWidgetId for demand.
     int32_t id = appWidgetIds[0];
     mDemand->putIntExtra(AppWidgetManager::EXTRA_APPWIDGET_ID(), id);
     pendingDemand* mPendingDemand = PendingDemand::getBroadcastN(*context, *mDemand,
         PendingDemand::FLAG_UPDATE_CURRENT);
     rw->setOnClickPendingDemand(MyAppWidgetProviderTest::R::id::button, mPendingDemand);
     if (mDemand != NULL) delete mDemand;
     if (mPendingDemand != NULL) delete mPendingDemand;

     // Set remote adapter, if your RemoteWidget contains collection widget(ex. ListWidget)
     String serviceClassName("ListAppWidgetProvider.MyListAppWidgetService");
     Demand* remoteDemand = new Demand();
     remoteDemand->setClassName(*mspPackageName, *mspServiceClassName);
     remoteDemand->putIntExtra(AppWidgetManager::EXTRA_APPWIDGET_ID(), id);
     rw->setRemoteAdapter(id, MyAppWidgetProviderTest::R::id::list_widget, remoteDemand);
     if (remoteDemand != NULL) delete remoteDemand;

     // Call a method taking one int32_t on a widget in the layout for this RemoteWidget.
     // EX: call TextWidget::setLine(int32_t)
     rw->setInt(MyAppWidgetProviderTest::R::id::text_widget, RemoteWidget::SET_LINE(), 10);

     // Update AppWidget.
     appWidgetManager->updateAppWidget(id, rw);
     if (rw != NULL) delete rw;
 }

void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setAnimation ( int32_t  widgetId,
int32_t  animId,
const core::PendingDemand *  startPendingDemand = NULL,
const core::PendingDemand *  endPendingDemand = NULL 
)

Load Animation resource and start animation with specified widget.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the widget whose would like to apply animation.
animIdThe resource id of the animation which would like to apply.
startPendingDemandThe PendingDemand to send when animation start.
endPendingDemandThe PendingDemand to send when animation end.

void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setBitmap ( int32_t  widgetId,
const base::String &  methodName,
const graphics::Bitmap *  value 
)

Call a method taking one Bitmap on a widget in the layout for this RemoteWidget.

Note: The bitmap will be flattened into the parcel if this object is sent across processes, so it may end up using a lot of memory, and may be fairly slow.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the widget on which to call the method.
methodNameThe name of the method to call.
valueThe value to pass to the method.

void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setChronometer ( int32_t  widgetId,
int64_t  base,
const gaia::base::String &  format,
bool  started 
)

Equivalent to calling Chronometer.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the Chronometer to change.
baseThe time at which the timer would have read 0:00. This time should be based off of SystemClock::elapsedRealtime().
formatThe Chronometer format string, or null to simply display the timer value.
startedTrue if you want the clock to be started, false if not.
void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setDemand ( int32_t  widgetId,
const base::String &  methodName,
const core::Demand *  value 
)

Call a method taking one Demand on a widget in the layout for this RemoteWidget.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the widget on which to call the method.
methodNameThe name of the method to call.
valueThe value to pass to the method.
void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setDrawerParameters ( int32_t  widgetId,
bool  targetBackground,
int32_t  alpha,
int32_t  colorFilter,
graphics::PorterDuff::Mode  mode,
int32_t  level 
)

Equivalent to call a combination of Drawer::setAlpha, Drawer::setColorFilter, and/or Drawer::setLevel on the Drawer of a given widget.

You can omit specific calls by marking their values with null or -1.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the widget that contains the target Drawer
targetBackgroundIf true, apply these parameters to the Drawer returned by Widget::getBackground. Otherwise, assume the target widget is an ImageWidget and apply them to ImageWidget::getDrawer.
alphaSpecify an alpha value for the drawer, or -1 to leave unchanged.
colorFilterSpecify a color for a ColorFilter for this drawer, or -1 to leave unchanged.
modeSpecify a PorterDuff mode for this drawer, or null to leave unchanged.
levelSpecify the level for the drawer, or -1 to leave unchanged.
void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setEmptyWidget ( int32_t  widgetId,
int32_t  emptyWidgetId 
)

Equivalent to call AbsListWidget::setEmptyWidget.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the widget on which to set the empty widget.
emptyWidgetIdThe widget id of the empty widget.
void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setFloat ( int32_t  widgetId,
const base::String &  methodName,
float  value 
)

Call a method taking one float on a widget in the layout for this RemoteWidget.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the widget on which to call the method.
methodNameThe name of the method to call.
valueThe value to pass to the method.

void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setOnClickFillInDemand ( int32_t  widgetId,
const core::Demand *  fillInDemand 
)

When using collections (eg.

ListWidget, StackWidget etc.) in appwidgets, it is very costly to set PendingDemand on the individual items, and is hence not permitted. Instead a single PendingDemand template can be set on the collection, see setPendingDemandTemplate, and the individual on-click action of a given item can be distinguished by setting a fillInDemand on that item.

The fillInDemand is then combined with the PendingDemand template in order to determine the final demand which will be executed when the item is clicked. This works as follows: any fields which are left blank in the PendingDemand template, but are provided by the fillInDemand will be overwritten, and the resulting PendingDemand will be used.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the widget on which to set the fillInDemand.
fillInDemandThe demand which will be combined with the parent's PendingDemand in order to determine the on-click behavior of the widget specified by widgetId.
void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setOnClickPendingDemand ( int32_t  widgetId,
const core::PendingDemand *  pendingDemand 
)

Equivalent to call Widget::setOnClickListener to launch the provided PendingDemand.

When setting the on-click action of items within collections (eg. ListWidget, StackWidget etc.), this method will not work. Instead, use setPendingDemandTemplate in conjunction with setOnClickFillInDemand.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the widget that will trigger the PendingDemand when clicked
pendingDemandThe PendingDemand to send when user clicks.
void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setPendingDemandTemplate ( int32_t  widgetId,
const core::PendingDemand *  pendingDemandTemplate 
)

When using collections (eg.

ListWidget, StackWidget etc.) in appwidgets, it is very costly to set PendingDemand on the individual items, and is hence not permitted. Instead this method should be used to set a single PendingDemand template on the collection, and individual items can differentiate their on-click behavior using setOnClickFillInDemand.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the collection who's children will use this PendingDemand template when clicked.
pendingDemandTemplateThe PendingDemand to be combined with extras specified by a child of widgetId and executed when that child is clicked.
void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::setProgressBar ( int32_t  widgetId,
int32_t  max,
int32_t  progress,
bool  indeterminate 
)

Equivalent to call a combination of ProgressBar::setMax, ProgressBar::setProgress and ProgressBar::setIndeterminate.

If indeterminate is true, then the values for max and progress are ignored.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the ProgressBar to change.
maxThe 100% value for the progress bar.
progressThe current value of the progress bar.
indeterminateTrue if the progress bar is indeterminate, false if not.

void gaia::ui::RemoteWidget::startAnimationDrawerOneShot ( int32_t  widgetId,
bool  targetBackground 
)

Equivalent to call a combination of AnimationDrawer::setOneShot and AnimationDrawer::start of a given widget.

Parameters:
widgetIdThe id of the widget that contains the target Drawer
targetBackgroundIf true, apply these parameters to the Drawer returned by Widget::getBackground. Otherwise, assume the target widget is an ImageWidget and apply them to ImageWidget::getDrawer.
